caption.title: Changes of average annual milk loss values calculated with six different milk loss methods (THI thr = 70) for a 25×25 km grid cell in South-East England (centroid: 51.0°N, 0.7°W).
caption.p: Form of the fitted exponential curve: AML = a×e b×(y-2010); M1-2: a = 27.86, b = 0.0234, SE a = 1.68, SE b = 0.00074, R 2 = 0.989, NRMSE = 7.4%; M3-4: a = 6.13, b = 0.0251, SE a = 0.456, SE b = 0.0009, R 2 = 0.986, NRMSE = 6.6%; M5-6: a = 17.19, b = 0.0229, SE a = 1.11, SE b = 0.00079, R 2 = 0.986; NRMSE = 6.8%. U test showed significant difference (P < 0.001) between the milk loss calculation methods: M1-2 different from M3-4 and both pairs different from M5-6.
